title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
summary: A novel set in the American South during the 1930s, focusing on themes of racial injustice and moral growth.

author: George Orwell
summary: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society ruled by the Party and Big Brother.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
summary: A classic novel that explores the issues of marriage, class, and morality in early 19th century England.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
summary: A novel that critiques the American Dream through the story of Jay Gatsby and his unrequited love for Daisy Buchanan.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
summary: An epic tale of the obsessive quest of Captain Ahab for revenge on Moby Dick, the white whale.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
summary: A story about teenage alienation and angst, narrated by the disenchanted Holden Caulfield.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
summary: A sweeping novel that intertwines the lives of private and public individuals during the time of the Napoleonic wars.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: The prelude to The Lord of the Rings, following the journey of Bilbo Baggins as he goes on an unexpected adventure.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
summary: A psychological drama exploring the moral dilemmas faced by the impoverished student Raskolnikov after he commits a murder.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
summary: A philosophical book about a young shepherd named Santiago who goes on a journey to discover his personal legend.
